meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something ugly.
meanings.sent1: The graffiti artist was known as the neighborhood uglifiers.
meanings.sent2: The uglifiers in the painting ruined its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids were the little uglifiers of the park benches.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds acted as nature's uglifiers, darkening the sky.
meanings.sent5: The factory's smokestacks were the industrial uglifiers of the town.

meanings.definition: A substance or tool used to make something less attractive.
meanings.sent1: The cheap paint was an ineffective uglifier for the walls.
meanings.sent2: She used the makeup as an instant uglifier for the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The broken mirror became an accidental uglifier in the room.
meanings.sent4: The fog acted as a natural uglifier, obscuring the view.
meanings.sent5: The old curtains were the unintentional uglifiers of the room.

meanings.definition: The act of making something unattractive.
meanings.sent1: The uglifiers of the building renovation were evident in the mismatched colors.
meanings.sent2: Her criticism served as a verbal uglifier to his artwork.
meanings.sent3: The rain played the role of an unexpected uglifier to the outdoor event.
meanings.sent4: The weeds were the persistent uglifiers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The vandalism was a blatant act of uglifiers on the statue.
